title: tikv panic with “[\"unexpected error: Store(Other(Other(\\\"[components/raft_log_engine/src/engine.rs:807]: Corruption: file seqno out of range\\\")))” when run sysbench prepare
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
./tikv-server -V
 TiKV 
Release Version:   8.3.0
Edition:           Community
Git Commit Hash:   72fc9f13c6643aa1919ac6c3eab28d06177fce1b
Git Commit Branch: HEAD
UTC Build Time:    2024-08-13 09:27:19
Rust Version:      rustc 1.77.0-nightly (89e2160c4 2023-12-27)
Enable Features:   memory-engine pprof-fp jemalloc mem-profiling portable sse test-engine-kv-rocksdb test-engine-raft-raft-engine trace-async-tasks openssl-vendored
Profile:           dist_release
2024-08-15T03:26:47.879+0800

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
8c/32g

### Steps to reproduce
1、run sysbench prepare

### What did you expect?
no panic

### What did happened?
tikv panic

comments_data.body:
It seems that the `panic` is caused by reading some abnormal entry indexes, whose file-ids are out of range.

Maybe there exists some bugs in raft-engine, when `rewriting` stale raft logs without updating the out-of-date indexes in `memtable` timely, and these bugs caused this issue.

But the root cause is not clear and needs to be re-produced.
It should be a historical issue in raft-engine, not a new issue for raft-engine, which means that it should not be regarded as an blocked issue.

Supplement an extra info or metrics for this issue:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9f00e7f3-9c1b-4033-ae0a-79339538cfa1)

as we can see, this issue happened during the period of executing `rewrite-rewrite` operations (or maybe after executing `rewrite-rewrite` operations)
